subject: Re: generate Suites for existing TestCases
msgSnippet: ... You can also create a testSuite (in the New menu) that will gather all the TestCases in that package.  Thought it is non-intuitive, you do the same thing
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:

> Additionally, if you are using Eclipse selecting a project and
> clicking 'Run as JUnit' will run all tests in that project as well
> as tests found in projects it depends on.

You can also create a testSuite (in the "New" menu) that will gather
all the TestCases in that package. Thought it is non-intuitive, you
do the same thing (after selecting the TestSuite) to update it. It
gives you a list of the TestCases with a checkbox next to each.

Dave
